title: 107_hr5075
content: The Act titled "American 5-Cent Coin Design Continuity Act of 2002" mandates designs on the 5-cent coin commemorating the bicentennial of the Louisiana Purchase. The Secretary of the Treasury may change the design of the 5-cent coin for 2003 and 2004 in honor of the Louisiana Purchase bicentennial, featuring President Thomas Jefferson on the obverse and a design commemorating Louisiana on the reverse. In 2004, the design of the 5-cent coin will commemorate the Louisiana Purchase, with other inscriptions meeting all requirements for circulating coins. SEC. 3 amends the design of the 5-cent coin to feature Thomas Jefferson and Monticello. SEC. 4 establishes the Coin Design Advisory Committee. The Coin Design Advisory Committee is established with 9 members, including the Chief of Staff to the Secretary of the Treasury and 4 persons appointed by the President. The Coin Design Advisory Committee consists of 9 members, including individuals with expertise in numismatic collections, medallic arts or sculpture, and American history. The Coin Design Advisory Committee consists of 9 members with expertise in numismatic collections, medallic arts, sculpture, and American history. Members are appointed based on their education, training, or experience in these areas, including staff employees of the House of Representatives. The Coin Design Advisory Committee includes 9 members appointed based on their expertise in numismatic collections, medallic arts, sculpture, and American history. Members are appointed by the minority and majority leaders of the House of Representatives and Senate, respectively, based on their education, training, or experience. The Coin Design Advisory Committee consists of 9 members appointed by the minority and majority leaders of the House of Representatives and Senate. Appointed members can continue to serve after their term until a successor is appointed. Vacancies on the committee are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Coin Design Advisory Committee allows acting officials to serve in vacant positions. The Chairperson is the person in the position described in paragraph (1)(A). Members serve without pay but are reimbursed for expenses. The Advisory Committee members are reimbursed for expenses from the Mint Public Enterprise Fund. They must meet quarterly and 7 members constitute a quorum. Their duties include advising the Secretary of the Treasury on design proposals for coins and numismatic items. The Advisory Committee members are reimbursed for expenses from the Mint Public Enterprise Fund and must meet quarterly. They advise the Secretary of the Treasury on design proposals for coins and numismatic items. The Secretary may request any proposals or issues from the Committee. The Director of the Mint provides administrative support services upon request. The Committee submits an annual report to specific congressional committees. The Advisory Committee to the Secretary of the Treasury meets quarterly to advise on design proposals for coins and numismatic items. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to the Committee, but meetings are open to the public after notice in the Federal Register.
